head.title: Seeking Energy in All the Odd Places

hedline.hl1: Seeking Energy in All the Odd Places

abstract.p: Larry P Walker and David B Wilson letter seconds May 1 editorial urging development of cellulosic ethanol as alternative fuel; drawing

block.p: We commend you for your objective and timely support of cellulosic ethanol. The challenge is to continue to develop this renewable energy source in an environmentally and economically sustainable manner.

We commend you for your objective and timely support of cellulosic ethanol. The challenge is to continue to develop this renewable energy source in an environmentally and economically sustainable manner.
Through science and engineering, there will be continued improvement in the energy efficiency and environmental sustainability of this important renewable energy source.

In the coming years, petroleum will continue to be an important part of our energy future. But a combination of aggressive energy conservation and thoughtful and aggressive development of renewable energy technology will help this country face the political and economic challenges associated with our addiction to oil.
Cellulosic ethanol has the added advantages of increasing economic opportunities for rural communities and strengthening our global competitive edge by leveraging our science and technology capacity.
Larry P. Walker David B. Wilson Ithaca, N.Y., May 2, 2006
The writers are professors of, respectively, biological engineering and molecular biology at Cornell University.
